article_title: Twitter responds to the president’s new account with stream of racist vitriol
article_text:
Topics: Media News, News, Politics News

The sitting President of the United States thought it was a good idea to start a personal Twitter account, despite the fact that most of the people who would respond to anything he tweeted believe him to be a Muslim Kenyan usurper who shouldn’t have been eligible to run for president in the first place.

Barack Obama’s initial tweet was charming, self-deprecating missive to Americans:

Hello, Twitter! It's Barack. Really! Six years in, they're finally giving me my own account. — President Obama (@POTUS) May 18, 2015

Which, of course, led to this:

@POTUS sup — Becca Piano (@BeccaPiano) May 19, 2015

Which is the nicest thing the president ever will hear on Twitter. Most people were more like this:

article_metadata.description: Anyone still questioning whether we're living in a post-racial America has their answer

— President Obama (@POTUS) May 18, 2015Which, of course, led to this:@POTUS sup — Becca Piano (@BeccaPiano) May 19, 2015Which is the nicest thing the president ever will hear on Twitter.
Barack Obama’s initial tweet was charming, self-deprecating missive to Americans:Hello, Twitter!
Six years in, they're finally giving me my own account.
Most people were more like this:
It's Barack.
